Recommendations: 1. If funds warrant, the University may install additional lighting system, repair or replace the defective electric fans.
2. Safety and precautionary measures may be printed to be readable and be posted visibly.
3. Fire extinguishers are suggested to be placed at conspicuous places for accessibility.
4. It is encouraged that all laboratory rooms and shops may be provided with first aid cabinets with medicines and post antidote charts.
5. The management may schedule a regular conduct of fire and earthquake drill.
6. The department may apply the 5s principle to put things in order.
7. If possible, a laboratory technician may be hired so that the faculty will focus on their instruction functions.
8. Chemical stockrooms may be free from other supplies and equipment.
9. If budget warrants, the department may purchase laboratory equipment in consonance to the course requirements.
